title: Linker fails to find opendir and readdir in macho.c

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Currently on macOS 10.13.3 trying to compile a basic hello world program using rustc. Getting an error in the linker saying that the symbols "_opendir$INODE64" and "_readdir$INODE64" can not be found.

Not sure if this is a gcc issue since there are some warnings about using the IOS simulator of gcc. 

Running gcc --version gives me:

```
Configured with: --prefix=/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/usr --with-gxx-include-dir=/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneSimulator11.2.sdk/usr/include/c++/4.2.1
Apple LLVM version 9.0.0 (clang-900.0.39.2)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin17.4.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
```

I tried installing gcc-4.9 and symlinking the command gcc to it in `/usr/local/bin` however I think rustc is still using the IOS version. Since the warnings for IOS did not go away.


[error.log](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/1826891/error.log)
